page.title: 03Agriculture in Well
page.content: There are 5 farms within the village and each is quite different.Pear Tree Farm is traditional with dairy cows stock and sheep.At School House Farm they have hens,ducks,geese and breed rabbits for the table.A large dairy herd at Smirthwaits' farm makes them keenly aware of milk quota problems. Manor House Farm has New Year lambs, piglets,suckling calves and free range hens.Well Hall Farm is changing to include vegetable growing and employs seasonal workers.Acclom Farm is a modern efficient business run by father and son with 5 men,seasonal workers & boys doing Saturday jobs.It is a mixed farm with 2 special crops - potatoes (Pentland Squire) strictly limited by quota , and seed corn which must be grown, dried and stored under ideal conditions.
